text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Pico-8 is a fantasy console (a fictional video game console). The graphical display is limited to 16 colors with a resolution of 128x128 pixels, sound is limited to 4 separate channels. This encourages devs to go for a minimalistic, retro-era aesthetic. The games are programmed in a friendly LUA environment and the engine itself can be used to create and publish the games, including creating all the elements of the game such as the sprites, sounds, backgrounds, etc. The most infamous game made for the Pico-8 is Celeste, which would go on to be ported to many other platforms.
